Package ibis.cashmere.constellation

Class Launch

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.cashmere.constellation.Launch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    KernelLaunch, LibFuncLaunch
    public abstract class Launch
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract base class for KernelLaunch and LibFuncLaunch that contains shared code.

    • Method Detail

      • setArgument

        public void setArgument​(int i,
                        Argument.Direction d)
        Set an argument for this launch. The value will be copied to the device before the kernel launches.
        Parameters:
        i - the argument to be set for this kernel
        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both

        Parameters:

      • setArgument

        public void setArgument​(Pointer p,
                        Argument.Direction d)
        Set an argument for this launch. This method will throw an UnsupportedOperationException because Pointer p is a pointer that points to device memory. Hence, it cannot be copied. The "noCopy" variant should be used. This variant is available in the Cashmere library because the MCL compiler may generate this variant.
        Parameters:
        p - the argument to be set for this kernel
        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both

      • setArgument

        public void setArgument​(int[] a,
                        Argument.Direction d)
        Set an argument for this launch. The value will be copied to the device before the kernel launches.
        Parameters:
        a - the argument to be set for this kernel
        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both

      • setArgument

        Set an argument for this launch. The value will be copied to the device before the kernel launches.
        Parameters:

        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both

      • setArgumentNoCopy

        public void setArgumentNoCopy​(float[] a,
                              Argument.Direction d)
        Set an argument for this launch. The user is responsible for copying the data to the device using Device.copy(float[],Argument.Direction).
        Parameters:
        a - the argument to be set for this kernel
        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both

      • setArgumentNoCopy

        public void setArgumentNoCopy​(double[] a,
                              Argument.Direction d)
        Set an argument for this launch. The user is responsible for copying the data to the device using Device.copy(double[],Argument.Direction).
        Parameters:
        a - the argument to be set for this kernel
        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both

      • setArgumentNoCopy

        Parameters:
        a - the argument to be set for this kernel
        d - indicates whether the value is only read, only written, or both
